title: 'Billions' actress Melissa Errico helped save a man in the subway
text:
(CNN) It seems Melissa Errico was at the right place at the right time.

The singer and Broadway actress known to many for her role on the Showtime series "Billions," has shared a story of helping save a man who fell on the subway tracks in New York City.

She tweeted about it Wednesday, writing "I just pulled a man off the subway tracks on 16th street."

I just pulled a man off the subway tracks on 16th street. Helping two other men who needed a third helper, an extra yank. We had to move fast. He had fallen stone drunk, bloodied elbows, broken foot. Poor soul. Saw so many good people caring. #NewYork oh my heart. #TakeCare — Melissa Errico (@melissa_errico) August 28, 2019

"Helping two other men who needed a third helper, an extra yank," Errico tweeted. "We had to move fast."

Errico told People magazine she was in the 14th Street F train station when she heard screams for help.
